meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a weasel in behavior or appearance.
meanings.sent1: The weasely movements of the cat caught the attention of the curious child.
meanings.sent2: Her weasely smile made me question her true intentions.
meanings.sent3: The weasely squirrel tried to sneak into the bird feeder but got stuck.
meanings.sent4: His weasely eyes darted around the room, searching for an escape.
meanings.sent5: The weasely behavior of the fox made it difficult to trust.

meanings.definition: Acting in a deceitful or sneaky manner.
meanings.sent1: The weasely salesman tried to convince me to buy a faulty product.
meanings.sent2: She gave me a weasely excuse for being late to the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The weasely student tried to copy answers during the test but got caught.
meanings.sent4: His weasely tactics in the negotiation left everyone feeling uneasy.
meanings.sent5: The weasely behavior of the raccoon made it hard to keep him out of the trash.
